entry.title: CVE-2025-47812
entry.content:
æè¿°ï¼š ** RESERVED ** This candidate has been reserved by an organization or individual that will use it when announcing a new security problem. When the candidate has been publicized, the details for this candidate will be provided.

On June 30, 2025 a detailed technical analysis of CVE-2025-47812 was published by the original finders, RCE Security. This analysis shows how an anonymous user (with no password), can leverage a NULL byte injection issue, allowing for arbitrary attacker-controlled LUA code to be placed in a session file. An attacker can then execute this arbitrary LUA code to achieve RCE. The technical analysis shows this occurring with root privileges by default on a Linux based system, and notes that on Windows, code execution will be as NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM.

On July 1, 2025, a Metasploit exploit module for CVE-2025-47812 was added the Metasploit pull queue.

Given this is a file transfer server, is vulnerable to unauthenticated RCE, and public exploit code is available, I have rated this as Extremely High attacker Value, and Extremely High exploitability.

entry.title: The education theme for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to,
entry.content:
é“¾æ¥ï¼š https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v5pf-366x-4gxg

CVSS è¯„åˆ†ï¼š 9.8

å‚è€ƒé“¾æ¥ï¼š

  • https://nvd.nist.gov/vuln/detail/CVE-2024-13786

  • https://themeforest.net/item/education-center-training-courses-wordpress-theme/10652918#item-description__change-log

  • https://www.wordfence.com/threat-intel/vulnerabilities/id/d0b27bc8-617a-4f98-954f-e49f87dca311?source=cve

  • https://github.com/advisories/GHSA-v5pf-366x-4gxg

æè¿°ï¼š

The education theme for WordPress is vulnerable to PHP Object Injection in all versions up to, and including, 3.6.10 via deserialization of untrusted input in the â€˜themerex_callback_view_more_postsâ€™ function. This makes it possible for unauthenticated attackers to inject a PHP Object. No known POP chain is present in the vulnerable software, which means this vulnerability has no impact unless another plugin or theme containing a POP chain is installed on the site. If a POP chain is present via an additional plugin or theme installed on the target system, it may allow the attacker to perform actions like delete arbitrary files, retrieve sensitive data, or execute code depending on the POP chain present.

entry.title: FortiOS æµ‹è¯•ç¯å¢ƒæ¼æ´
entry.content:
æ¼æ´ä¿¡æ¯

æ¼æ´åç§°ï¼š FortiOS æµ‹è¯•ç¯å¢ƒæ¼æ´

æ¼æ´ç¼–å·ï¼š

  • CVEï¼š CVE-2024-23113

æ¼æ´ç±»å‹ï¼š å…¶ä»–

æ¼æ´ç­‰çº§ï¼š é«˜å±

æ¼æ´æè¿°ï¼š è¿™æ˜¯ä¸€ä¸ªDockeråŸºç¡€çš„æµ‹è¯•ç¯å¢ƒï¼Œç”¨äºéªŒè¯CVE-2024-23113 Nucleiæ¨¡æ¿å¯¹æ¨¡æ‹Ÿçš„æ˜“å—æ”»å‡»çš„FortiOSå®ä¾‹çš„æ£€æµ‹èƒ½åŠ›ã€‚å®ƒæä¾›äº†åŒ…æ‹¬ç™»å½•é¡µé¢ã€APIç«¯ç‚¹å’Œæ­£ç¡®çš„ç‰ˆæœ¬ä¿¡æ¯åœ¨å†…çš„çœŸå®FortiOSå“åº”ã€‚

äº§å“å‚å•†ï¼š Fortinet

äº§å“åç§°ï¼š FortiOS

å½±å“ç‰ˆæœ¬ï¼š 7.4.0, 7.4.1, 7.4.2, 7.2.0 through 7.2.6, 7.0.0 through 7.0.13

æ¥æºï¼š https://github.com/MAVRICK-1/cve-2024-23113-test-env

ç±»å‹ï¼š CVE-2024:github search

ä»“åº“æ–‡ä»¶

  • .dockerignore
  • Dockerfile
  • README.md
  • docker-compose.yml
  • server.py

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

CVE-2024-23113 FortiOS Test Environment

A Docker-based test environment for validating CVE-2024-23113 Nuclei templates against simulated vulnerable FortiOS instances.

ğŸ” Overview

This environment simulates vulnerable FortiOS HTTP interfaces to test the detection capabilities of CVE-2024-23113 Nuclei templates. It provides realistic FortiOS responses including login pages, API endpoints, and proper version information.

ğŸš€ Quick Start

Prerequisites

  • Docker
  • Docker Compose
  • Nuclei (for testing)

Basic Setup

  1. Clone and build:
  1. Verify the environment:
  1. Test with Nuclei:

ğŸ¯ Available Environments

Default Environment

  • Service: fortios-vulnerable
  • Port: 8080
  • Version: FortiOS v7.2.5 (vulnerable)
  • URL: http://localhost:8080

Additional Test Environments

Available Profiles:
  • Default: FortiOS v7.2.5 (vulnerable) - Port 8080
  • Patched: FortiOS v7.2.7 (patched) - Port 8081
  • Multiple:
    • FortiOS v7.4.1 (vulnerable) - Port 8082
    • FortiOS v7.0.10 (vulnerable) - Port 8083

ğŸ”§ Configuration

Environment Variables

VariableDescriptionDefault
FORTIOS_VERSIONFortiOS version to simulate7.2.5
PORTContainer internal port8080

Custom Version

ğŸ“¡ API Endpoints

The simulated FortiOS provides these endpoints:

EndpointDescriptionContent-Type
/Main login pagetext/html
/loginLogin formtext/html
/remote/loginRemote access portaltext/html
/api/v2/monitor/system/statusSystem status APIapplication/json
/api/v2/cmdb/system/globalGlobal config APIapplication/json

Example API Response

ğŸ§ª Testing Scenarios

Vulnerable Versions Detection

Patched Version Validation

Batch Testing

ğŸ” Manual Testing

Check Service Response

Expected Vulnerable Indicators

  • HTML: Contains FortiOS v7.2.5
  • Server Header: FortiGate-HTTP/v7.2.5
  • API Response: "version": "v7.2.5"

ğŸ› Troubleshooting

Common Issues

Port Already in Use
Container Wonâ€™t Start
Health Check Failing

Debugging

ğŸ“‹ Vulnerable Versions

This environment can simulate any of these vulnerable versions:

FortiOS

  • 7.4.0, 7.4.1, 7.4.2
  • 7.2.0 through 7.2.6
  • 7.0.0 through 7.0.13

FortiProxy

  • 7.4.0, 7.4.1, 7.4.2
  • 7.2.0 through 7.2.8
  • 7.0.0 through 7.0.14

Example Usage

ğŸ—ï¸ Development

Building from Source

Customizing Responses

Edit server.py to modify:

  • HTML responses
  • API endpoint data
  • Server headers
  • Version information

âš ï¸ Security Notice

This is a test environment only:

  • âœ… Use for security testing and template validation
  • âœ… Use in isolated lab environments
  • âŒ Never expose to public networks
  • âŒ Never use in production

ğŸ“š References

  • CVE-2024-23113 Details
  • Fortinet Security Advisory
  • CISA KEV Catalog
  • Nuclei Templates Repository

ğŸ“ Support

For issues with this test environment:

  1. Check the troubleshooting section
  2. Review container logs
  3. Verify Nuclei template syntax
  4. Test with manual curl requests

Remember: This environment is for authorized security testing only. Always ensure you have permission before testing any systems.

  • https///github.com:r00tb1t/CVE-2024-21413-POC.git

  • https///github.com:duy-31/CVE-2024-21413.git

KEV: True

Shodan Query: NA

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.

æ¥æºæ¦‚è¿°

Description:

Fortinet FortiOS (versions 7.4.0-7.4.2, 7.2.0-7.2.6, 7.0.0-7.0.13), FortiProxy (versions 7.4.0-7.4.2, 7.2.0-7.2.8, 7.0.0-7.0.14), FortiPAM (versions 1.2.0, 1.1.0-1.1.2, 1.0.0-1.0.3), and FortiSwitchManager (versions 7.2.0-7.2.3, 7.0.0-7.0.3) contain a use of externally-controlled format string caused by processing specially crafted packets, letting attackers execute arbitrary code or commands.

Severity: Critical
POC:
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/aad788d038d3
  • https://github.com/valornode/CVE-2024-23113
  • https///github.com:valornode/CVE-2024-23113.git

  • https://github.com/expl0itsecurity/CVE-2024-23113
  • https://vulncheck.com/xdb/0548206afc9c

KEV: True

Shodan Query: cpe:"cpe:2.3:o:fortinet:fortios"

Acceptance Criteria: The template must include a complete POC and should not rely solely on version-based detection. Contributors are required to provide debug data(-debug) along with the template to help the triage team with validation or can also share a vulnerable environment like docker file.

Rewards will only be given once the template is fully validated by the team. Templates that are incomplete or invalid will not be accepted. Avoid adding code templates for CVEs that can be achieved using HTTP, TCP, or JavaScript. Such templates are blocked by default and wonâ€™t produce results, so we prioritize creating templates with other protocols unless exceptions are made.

You can check the FAQ for the Nuclei Templates Community Rewards Program here.
